arm_group.description:
Focal muscular vibration will be applied at mGCM of each subject for 10 minutes in each session.
Frequency: 40, 80, 120 Hz Amplitude: 0.1, 0.3, 0.5 mm

brief_summary.textblock:
The overall aim of the proposed study is to determine optimal parameter of focal muscle
      vibration for improving spasticity and identify neurophysiological mechanism in healthy
      subjects.

      In investigation I-1, subjects will undergo focal muscle vibration with 40, 80, 120 Hz
      frequency at the medial gastrocnemius muscles (mGCM). As a surrogate maker of spasticity,
      H-reflex and compound motor action potential (CMAP) of the tibial nerve at mGCM will be
      recorded pre, during, and post vibration.

      In investigation I-2, subjects will undergo focal muscle vibration with 0.1, 0.3, 0.5 mm
      amplitude at mGCM. H-reflex and CMAP of the tibial nerve at mGCM will be recorded pre,
      during, and post vibration.

      In investigation II, subjects will undergo focal muscle vibration with predetermined
      parameters by the investigation I at mGCM. H-reflex and CMAP of the tibial nerve and motor
      evoked potential at mGCM will be recorded pre, during, and post vibration.

clinical_study.brief_title: Developing Optimal Focal Muscle Vibration for Improving Spasticity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy volunteer

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Unstable medical conditions

          -  History of epilepsy

          -  History of drug abuse

clinical_study.official_title: Optimization of Physical Focal Stimulation Parameters for Improving Spasticity and Identification of Neurophysiological Mechanism

primary_outcome.description: The ratio of maximal H-reflex amplitude (mV) to CMAP amplitude (mV) recorded at mGCM
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 1, 5 and 10 minutes during vibration, and 1 and 5 minutes after vibration

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: maximal H-reflex amplitude (mV) recorded at mGCM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 1, 5 and 10 minutes during vibration, and 1 and 5 minutes after vibration
baseline, 1, 5 and 10 minutes during vibration, and 1 and 5 minutes after vibration

secondary_outcome.description: Transcranial magnetic stimulation on the contralateral leg motor cortex is used to measure MEP at mGCM.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 10 minutes during vibration, and 5 minutes after vibration

secondary_outcome.description: Resting motor threshold (%) is defined as the minimal intensity of TMS capable of inducing MEPs greater than 100μV peak-to-peak amplitude in at least 3 of 5 trials.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 10 minutes during vibration, and 5 minutes after vibration

secondary_outcome.description: Short interval intracortical inhibition is recorded by using conditioning stimulus of 90% RMT and test stimulus of 120% RMT with 1ms interval.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 10 minutes during vibration, and 5 minutes after vibration

secondary_outcome.description: Intracortical facilitation is recorded by using conditioning stimulus of 90% RMT and test stimulus of 120% RMT with 10ms interval.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 10 minutes during vibration, and 5 minutes after vibration

collaborator.agency: Korea Institute of Science and Technology

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
